data.name: info_text_About_Us
data.value: Partlyx Version: 1.0.0 License: MIT Developed by Jiofef (Artyom Stepanov)

data.name: help_text_What_is_Partlyx
data.value:
Partlyx allows you to create schematics (recipes) of varying complexity, composed of components that can be any previously created resources.
What does Partlyx do? * Allows you to describe entities as a dependency graph * Visualizes a multi-level structure * Calculates total cost / weight / value across the entire graph * Allows you to find possible conversions between different resources * Works with abstract resource types

data.name: help_text_Some_QOL_Features
data.value:
Some complex or time-consuming actions can be simplified
* You can grab any part in the Parts Tree with the mouse and perform certain actions by releasing (dropping) it onto another compatible UI element. ** You can drop a grabbed recipe onto the "Default Recipe" property of a resource. If the recipe is compatible, it will be assigned to that property. ** You can drop a grabbed recipe onto the "Selected Recipe" property of a component. If the recipe is compatible, it will be assigned to that property. ** Similar to the previous ones, you can drop the captured resource over the "Input resource" and "Output resource" options in the resource converter. ** You can drag and drop the captured resource onto the "Inputs" or "Outputs" group in the recipe, and the resource will be added there as a component. You can also do this by dragging and dropping the captured resource onto the recipe node in the graph. ** While dragging a part, hovering over parts in the tree for a short time will automatically expand their list of child parts. ** While dragging a part, hovering over the focus button (eye icon) of parts will automatically activate it.
* The application supports hotkeys. They are displayed when you hover the mouse over the corresponding action (button or menu item) and wait briefly. ** In addition, some actions have hotkeys but no direct UI buttons. For example, the camera in the graph can be moved using the arrow keys (Up, Down, Left, Right). Holding Shift speeds up movement, while Ctrl slows it down.
* You can select multiple parts in the tree by holding Ctrl

data.name: Create_resource_with_recipe_by_default
data.value: Create resource with recipe by default

data.name: help_text_Resources_and_recipes
data.value:
Most actions are performed in the left panel — the element tree.
There are three types of elements: * Resources — store a list of recipes from which this resource can be obtained. * Recipes — transformations with a list of inputs and outputs in the form of components. * Components — specific instances of resources with a settable quantity.
In the "Resources" tab, you will see a tree divided into three layers from top to bottom: resources, recipes, and components. In the "Recipes" tab, you will see a list of all created recipes regardless of the resources they produce.
To create a resource, click the button at the bottom of the "Resources" tab. Recipes are created by clicking + on a resource in the tree or by clicking the "Create Recipe" button in the "Recipes" menu. Components are created in the same way by clicking on the list of recipe inputs and outputs — you will be offered a list of existing resources that can be taken as a component. Child elements of any tree element can be hidden or displayed by clicking the up/down arrow to the left of the element.
Each resource has a default recipe — default recipes are switched using the star-shaped button in the "Resources" tab. Each element in the tree has an "eye" button. When pressed, it toggles the focus of the element, meaning it opens or closes that element in the graph and the properties window. Each element has properties, such as the resource name or component quantity. These can be edited from the tree or in the properties window.
Any changes to a resource and its elements affect all recipes where this resource is used. You do not need to manually change the resource quantity in all recipes when making any changes.
You can change the appearance of resources and their recipes by changing their icon. This is done in the resource or recipe properties. Icons from many presets are available, and you can choose a color for them. You can enable the display of additional icons in the menu via the "Show all built-in icons" option. You can upload your own images and use them as icons.

data.name: help_text_Parts_graph
data.value:
The Parts Graph is located in the center of the screen and displays recipes.
* If a resource is selected, its **Default recipe** is shown. * If a recipe is selected, that recipe is shown. * If a component is selected, its parent recipe is shown.
The graph visualizes all parts of the tree as nodes and displays all necessary and obtained quantities of elements, counting the quantities of components
By default, the graph displays standard recipes for components, but you can change the recipe displayed for a specific component. For example, by clicking on the recipe below it in the graph
You can move the camera in the graph by holding the left mouse button and dragging. Zoom in and out using the mouse wheel.
By right-clicking a component in the graph, you can select "Open Branch", which will expand the Default or selected recipe of that component in the graph

data.name: help_text_Resources_converter
data.value:
The "Converter" is one of the tabs in the right menu.
The Converter allows you to find possible transformations between two given resources and displays other required and produced resources in the transformation. It also allows you to calculate the quantities of all these resources based on the input amount of the first resource or the required amount of the second resource.
You can select the input and the required output resource for the transformation, as well as specify the given/required number for one of them depending on the "Calculate via:" setting in the "Options" submenu.
After selecting the resources, possible transformations will be displayed at the bottom of the menu. Each transformation will appear as an element. The element will indicate the number of recipes needed to complete this transformation, as well as the amount of required and obtained resources.
You can examine each step of the transformation by clicking the "eye" icon in the corner of the element. This will open it in the graph window. The "Make Recipe" button will create a recipe where the inputs are the required components of this transformation and the outputs are the resulting components.
